turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That one -- from the wreck.  You brought it up, did you look inside it?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Well, what the hell -- might be something worth seeing.  Take it somewhere and see if there's film in it....

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: I know just where to go.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Of course not,  They're closed. Phil Fogarty's place.  He'll do it for me.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The drugstore's closed?  What the hell time is it?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Shit -- I'm late for dinner... Close up, okay?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Oh yeah -- I'm expecting a long distance call, very important. Give them my home phone.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: About an hour, maybe two.  Let's see -- I came on about eight....

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: I can't let you take her out.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: But I signed for the boat.  You' re not authorized any more.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Goddamnit, Hendricks, untie the rope there.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: About 10 degrees off your star- board bow, take a heading leeward of Sand Island, and lay her north by northeast....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Never mind that shit.  Just point.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: See where Cable Junction is?  Look to the left.  The lighthouse.  That's it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No place special.  Just hanging out.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know about him -- I'm going down to the dock, maybe go sailing.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What else is there to do?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You could work out at the beach, make a few bucks for school.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You'll have to make up your own mind about that.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What about tennis?  Riding? fixing up old cars?  Bartending?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Okay, not bartending.  Why on the water every day?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look, humor the old man -- just be careful.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll be careful.  I'll see y'later.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Don't go out if it's rough or any- thing, huh?  We've had a lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You stay right here.  You're going in with me.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You want to come here a minute?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I got something for you to do tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Sailing?  Forget it.  You're beached. Grounded.  No more boats.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No backtalk!  I spoke to Upton, at the beach, and he's got a job for you there.  You can work until school starts.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I passed out, but I'm okay.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: At least you're safe.  What about the others?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Jesus, don't freeze on me.  What about the others?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Stay here.  Don't go anywhere. Just stay here.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: I don't know what you did, but that kid stopped.  I haven't heard one peep, not one 'breaker breaker' for days.  Believe me, it's a pleasure....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You said something about a camera.

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Sure, sure -- Jeff Hendricks brought in this camera, see, from underwater, and I didn't know how to get it open, but my brother-in- law, in Montauk, he works at a hi- fi store, and they sell cameras, so he....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Well, yeah, I did, that's the funny thing.  You can't tell much from the negatives, I was going to blow 'em up.  Here's a test I did....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Not bad -- that's a real fast lens, probably 1.4.  Look at the diffusion, though....

turns.speaker: PHIL
turns.text: Let's see -- you got a minute?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Come on, Phil, don't jerk me around.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Fantastic lady.  Don't know what I'd do without her.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Y'know, Brody -- for the first time in years it's worth putting money into this town.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: All of us thank you, okay?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Sorry, I'm all booked up...  Come, m'dear.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Heck of a way to treat a taxpayer.  Don't you have any pull with the chief, here?

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Is Jeff Hendricks qualified to fill in as an interim Chief of Police in your absence?

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: It came up during the meeting.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look -- I just got this from Phil Fogarty.  It was in the camera belonging to the missing divers. It proves I was right, all along.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What are you all, blind?  It's a shark.  Look -- teeth, jaw, gills.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You're damn right that's what it is.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: What have you seen before?  This is nothing.  Seaweed.  Mud.  Some- thing in the lens.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Will you listen to this man? Will you just listen to him?  You really caused a panic on a public beach, you shoot up the place, God knows who could've been injured -- what if somebody de- cides to sue us?  That could ruin us.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Is that what it is?  Dollars? Money?  I'll pay for it.  Take it out of my salary.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Maybe I don't make as much money as some bullshit rip-off artists around here, but I don't work the same way.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: It means I don't like all that grab-ass and heavy breathing with my wife, it means I know who's out to screw me here, and it means that I know something none of you know because I've been there -- and I don't want to go through that horror again.  Ever!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: As soon as I heard about it, I called you.  This thing is big! His arms indicate big.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Come on, let's check the bite radius.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Bite radius.  You know, the size of the mouth?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The shark that did this.  It was a shark, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: We don't know that, do we?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: But that's what we're here to find out, right?

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: You don't tell me my job, and I won't tell you about yours, okay?

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: Could be a shark.  But maybe not.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look, I know a little bit about sharks.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I know that this was probably a Great White Shark.  Car-cadon... Caradan....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Is there one in these waters?

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: What makes you think there might be?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Because this big fish has been bitten by some other big fish....

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: This is a mammal, not a fish.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Jesus, don't quibble with me.  I want to know if a Great White Shark did this.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That's it?  Probably?  Look, sharks are attracted by blood, and thrashing around....

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: Sound.  Like sonar, or radar. They home in on irregular sounds, unusual sounds, any rhythmic low- frequency vibration.

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: Not necessarily.  These wounds could've been inflicted 30 miles out to sea, or more.  None of them are immediately fatal.  Currents could've carried the body 10 miles further.

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: It's either a Great White, or another killer whale.

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: Not when it's like this.  This animal has been ashore for 10, 12 hours, and drifting for a day, at least.  Every little nibbler in the sea's taken a bite.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Look -- can Great White Sharks communicate?  Send out signals, or something?  You know, take revenge, sense an enemy....

turns.speaker: ELKINS
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous -- Sharks don't take things personally.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I can see that. Don't you know this is a big deal?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Do I have to talk to those two?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: My boss and your boss.  Sure.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Can you take a little time out from your busy schedule to dance with the old man?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: And how.  I thought you wouldn't respect me.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Listen -- what are you doing later?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You have to smoke so early in the morning?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Why don't you take a half day and clean this junk up?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Because, I'm in the middle of a boating accident, I got only four regular cops and one secretary, and a Chief Deputy who is constantly fiddling with the police boat   He's another one.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Boat nut.  What is it about this place that makes everyone a freak for boating?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: It's an island.  Got to run.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Sort of -- Mathew Hooper is aboard the research vessel Aurora, presently in the Antarctic Ocean, and won't be in radio range until half-past next spring.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh, perfect -- a 75 per cent family affair.  Where were you?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That's what I said.  Is there any of that hand cleaner stuff?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Use the little brush there.  Why were you at Santos'?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Found one of the missing victims from that boat deal.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh.  Want to talk about it?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: He wanted a job, he's got one.  I want to see that boat out of the water by tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I know what you're going to say.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: In the city, it happened all the time -- some Kid o.d.'s on a rooftop, top, a drunk gets cut in pieces under the Brooklyn local, old people die alone in shitty apartments and three weeks later someone calls the cops because of the smell and the flies.  Call the cops.  What are we, immune?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: The goddamn smell is always the same.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Are you going to be able to sleep?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Yeah.   I think so.  Mike!  Keep it down, for chrissake!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Hi.  I closed a sale today, without Len.  That's $1200 commission, if the papers go through.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Ooohh, nothing.  I just got fired, that's all.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Then that's what I meant.  Fired. Canned.  Out on my fanny.  The Selectmen just made Hendricks the new Chief of Police.  Just like that.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: No sweat.  A blessing in disguise. Back to the city, you can go to Bloomingdale's without waiting six hours for the ferryboat...we're surrounded by water here, you realize that?  Me, surrounded by water...Ridiculous.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Stop that!  We're not going any place.  You love it here.  Tell me what the hell happened!

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Showed them the photo, showed them the goddamn Shark, big as life. They didn't see it.  Not like me. Not like the poor son-of-a-bitch who snapped this li'l picture...He's out there, somewhere... I shot off my gun, shot off my big mouth, so they fired me....

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Honey, this is nothing...I don't know what it is.  What did they....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: ...Everybody wants the job.  No one wants the authority. Except Hendricks.  Fine.  He can go out there in that precious boat, and when he looks whitey in his big mouth he can just call me.  Call me in New York...tell him to kiss my ass....

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: They have no right to treat you like that.  You've given them every- thing.  For four years, you've protected this town, the people on this island....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Fired me!  I'm not a hysterical man.  I'm responsible.  I know what I saw....

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I try.  Goddamnit, I tried...Now, I'm tired...I can't keep fighting it...I'm too tired...I'm...I'm....

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What're you going to do today?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Turn in the car.  Clean my desk, explain things to our sons, then maybe get shit-faced and punch your boss.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Don't rush into it -- we may need the income.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Hey -- it's not your job any more. I'm going to be late for work.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: What is it?  What's the matter?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Hello, hello.  It went well, I thought.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Thank you, thank you.  You know my son, don't you?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: I'm showing summer rentals.  We got a helluva season going.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: We have got to talk, and we have got to talk alone.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Larry, I don't know how to say this, but I think we got a shark problem. A real one.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Of course.  Look -- I've got some missing persons, fatalities, evidence of a large predator....

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: No one has seen a shark -- no fin, no bites, nothing.  Be realistic.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I got a feeling.  I have to act on it -- you can understand that, can't you?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Of course I can, but can't it wait? These things cost money, and this town doesn't have much money.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: We have done something -- hell, we damn near went broke putting up a shark watch tower on the beach -- it's the only one in 2000 miles, y'know.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: And I stood by while you told the people from Ramada and Marriott that if they put up a hotel they'd need $800,000 worth of steel net around their beaches!  In New England? We all lost on that one.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Martin, when we build up our tax base a little, you can have every- thing you want; right now, the town's broke.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Please, Larry -- there's good reason. Those water skiers....

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: A tragedy.  But that was a boating accident; no bites, no sharks, nothing but a boating accident.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Two of them are still missing!

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: There's always deaths in these waters that never turn up.  Are they all shark victims?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Bullshit?  I'll give you bullshit -- there's a dead whale out there with bites all over it!

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: What am I, an ass?  When you called me, I called Elkins, and her bosses. Nothing she saw is proof of anything.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Don't push it this time.  If you do, it won't turn out the way you want, I guarantee you that.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Thank God you guys were all together. I got something for you.  Proof!

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Martin, this is kind of an official meeting

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Chief -- the Board of Selectmen has a question only you can answer.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: What the hell does it take to make sense to you numbskulls?  Jesus, it's right there in front of you. I know what a goddamn shark looks like, I've been through it, don't you understand?  I've seen this sonofabitch before!

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Martin, could you wait here for a few minutes while we make up our minds about something?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Affirmative.  Can you get your chopper airborne?

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: 10-4, in a few minutes.  He's down checking a buoy in the Bay Channel.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Get him the hell over to Amity Point, the old lighthouse.  Right now.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: There's a bunch of Kids day-sailing that way.  Turn them back to port.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: That's it.  Just do it, all right?

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: 10-4,   soon as I can raise him.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: If they're not at the light, look for them.  I don't want them out there.  Get them back to port!

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: Affirmative, affirmative.  Turn the Kids day-sailing back to port.  I heard you.  Patrol out.

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Harbor Air, do you read?  Over?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: Where the hell is Air One?

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: That's what I'd like to know.  Lost transmission at Cable Junction.

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: Last transmission said ten juve- niles.

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: Then nothing.  If you see him, tell him to switch to an operational frequency, or give me a status report yourself.

turns.speaker: PATROL VOICE
turns.text: 1530 hours.  Might still be there. Base out.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Mom, Michael won't talk to me.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Can I go with you today?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: You stay with Mrs. Silvera, Tootsie. Okay?

turns.speaker: BRODY
turns.text: I'm okay, baby, I'm here.  It's okay....

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: They made me go with them.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: The lighthouse is a make-out spot.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Now I really want to see it.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: You going to fool around with Mike?  Well, I'm not doing anything with him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  So why aren't they doing it now?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Tide doesn't turn for three hours.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It killed her.  It ate her.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm not crazy about blind dates.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: My cousin will be here tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: You're not going out right away, are you?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I want you to meet my cousin.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: She just likes to tease.  I think she really likes you.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Did you ever see a dolphin?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Sure.  They like to play.  We may see some today.

turns.speaker: TERRY
turns.text: Whoops, almost lost one.  Can't play with the dolphins without skis....
